page.title: 16EDUCATION
page.content: EDINGTON COUNTY PRIMARY SCHOOL.-1985. The school has 25 pupils,two teachers,a part time secretary,two dinner ladies (cooked meals coming from Devizes),a part time cleaner and a crossing patrol. Pupils begin school at 5 yrs and at 11+ move to secondary education in one of the near-by towns. There is a mother's and toddler's group in the village,and many children go to the pre-school playgroup before starting state education. The most important change to be seen in the school is the high involvement of parents.They now regularly assist the teachers with transport to swimming in Westbury, reading practise, music, needlework and cookery lessons.Their fund-raising efforts also help to buy extra items like computers and cookers.During the past 108 years, there have only been 7 headteachers.
